reviewText: Football and civil rights, when it was more than a game.

This is an amazing DVD. It should be viewed by every Michigan Fan to learn the story of these two men. If you watch it, you will tell someone else about it. If Ford would have let the American people know about this story in 1976, he would have won the Presidential election against Carter.
It was an amazing story and even more amazing that it was all true.  Very well produced and edited.  We all enjoyed it:  3 generations!

A well-told story that is an important piece of Michigan football history and U.S. cultural history.  The documentary is both frustrating and heart-warming, reminding us of a day when unthinkable discrimination was the norm.

As a proud Michigan alum and native Michigander who has adopted transracially, this made me so proud of Gerald Ford and Willis Ward, for the good men that they were and for this story to finally be told.
